metadata.title: CVE-2019-12957 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a buffer over-read could be triggered inFoFiType1C::convertToType1 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc when the index number islarger than the charset array bounds. It can, for example, be triggered bysending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It allows an attackerto use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service or an informationleak, or possibly have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12957` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
poppler package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13').
